schema	Definition:  URL to JSON schema for this Vega-Lite specification.
background	Definition:  CSS color property to use as the background of visualization.Default value: none transparent
config	Definition:  None
config	Definition:  Vega-Lite configuration object.
config	area	Definition:  Area-Specific Config
config	area	Definition:  None
config	area	align	Definition:  None
config	area	align	Definition:  The horizontal alignment of the text. One of left, right, center.
config	area	angle	Definition:  The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.
config	area	baseline	Definition:  None
config	area	baseline	Definition:  The vertical alignment of the text. One of top, middle, bottom.Default value: middle
config	area	color	Definition:  Default color.Default value: span stylecolor: bspan b
config	area	dx	Definition:  The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	area	dy	Definition:  The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	area	fill	Definition:  Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	area	fillOpacity	Definition:  The fill opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	area	filled	Definition:  Whether the marks color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.Default value: true for all marks except point and false for point.Applicable for: bar, point, circle, square, and area marks.
config	area	font	Definition:  The typeface to set the text in e.g., Helvetica Neue.
config	area	fontSize	Definition:  The font size, in pixels.
config	area	fontStyle	Definition:  None
config	area	fontStyle	Definition:  The font style e.g., italic.
config	area	fontWeight	Definition:  None
config	area	fontWeight	Definition:  The font weight e.g., bold.
config	area	interpolate	Definition:  None
config	area	interpolate	Definition:  The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:- linear: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.- linear-closed: close the linear segments to form a polygon.- step: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- step-before: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.- step-after: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- basis: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- basis-open: an open B-spline may not intersect the start or end.- basis-closed: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.- cardinal: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- cardinal-open: an open Cardinal spline may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.- cardinal-closed: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.- bundle: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.- monotone: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.
config	area	opacity	Definition:  The overall opacity value between ,.Default value: . for non-aggregate plots with point, tick, circle, or square marks or layered bar charts and  otherwise.
config	area	orient	Definition:  None
config	area	orient	Definition:  The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.The value is either horizontal default or vertical.- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tickshould be applied to x or y dimension.- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the lineif config.sortLineBy is not specified.For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stacktherefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.
config	area	radius	Definition:  Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties.
config	area	shape	Definition:  The default symbol shape to use. One of: circle default, square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, or triangle-down, or a custom SVG path.Default value: circle
config	area	size	Definition:  The pixel area each the pointcirclesquare.For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.Default value: 
config	area	stroke	Definition:  Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	area	strokeDash	Definition:  An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.
config	area	strokeDash	items	Definition:  None
config	area	strokeDashOffset	Definition:  The offset in pixels into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.
config	area	strokeOpacity	Definition:  The stroke opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	area	strokeWidth	Definition:  The stroke width, in pixels.
config	area	tension	Definition:  Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter for line and area marks.
config	area	text	Definition:  Placeholder text if the text channel is not specified
config	area	theta	Definition:  Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties. Values for theta follow the same convention of arc mark startAngle and endAngle properties: angles are measured in radians, with  indicating north.
config	axis	Definition:  Generic axis config.
config	axis	Definition:  None
config	axis	domain	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if the domain the axis baseline should be included as part of the axis default true.
config	axis	domainColor	Definition:  Color of axis domain line.Default value:  none, using Vega default.
config	axis	domainWidth	Definition:  Stroke width of axis domain lineDefault value:  none, using Vega default.
config	axis	grid	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if grid lines should be included as part of the axisDefault value: true for  quantitative fields that are not binned and  time fields  otherwise, false.
config	axis	gridColor	Definition:  Color of gridlines.
config	axis	gridDash	Definition:  The offset in pixels into which to begin drawing with the grid dash array.
config	axis	gridDash	items	Definition:  None
config	axis	gridOpacity	Definition:  The stroke opacity of grid value between ,Default value:  by default
config	axis	gridWidth	Definition:  The grid width, in pixels.
config	axis	labelAngle	Definition:  The rotation angle of the axis labels.Default value: - for time or ordinal axis and  otherwise.
config	axis	labelColor	Definition:  The color of the tick label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	axis	labelFont	Definition:  The font of the tick label.
config	axis	labelFontSize	Definition:  The font size of the label, in pixels.Default value: .
config	axis	labelLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis tick labels.
config	axis	labels	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if labels should be included as part of the axis default true.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs labels true by default.
config	axis	maxExtent	Definition:  The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.
config	axis	minExtent	Definition:  The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.
config	axis	shortTimeLabels	Definition:  Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.Default value:  false
config	axis	tickColor	Definition:  The color of the axiss tick.
config	axis	tickSize	Definition:  The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs tickSize  by default.
config	axis	tickWidth	Definition:  The width, in pixels, of ticks.
config	axis	ticks	Definition:  Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.
config	axis	titleColor	Definition:  Color of the title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	axis	titleFont	Definition:  Font of the title. e.g., Helvetica Neue.
config	axis	titleFontSize	Definition:  Font size of the title.Default value: .
config	axis	titleFontWeight	Definition:  Font weight of the title. e.g., bold.
config	axis	titleLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis titles.
config	axis	titleMaxLength	Definition:  Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the fields description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.Default value:  automatically determined based on the cell size config.cell.width, config.cell.height
config	axis	titlePadding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between title and axis.
config	axisBand	Definition:  None
config	axisBand	Definition:  Specific axis config for axes with band scales.
config	axisBand	domain	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if the domain the axis baseline should be included as part of the axis default true.
config	axisBand	domainColor	Definition:  Color of axis domain line.Default value:  none, using Vega default.
config	axisBand	domainWidth	Definition:  Stroke width of axis domain lineDefault value:  none, using Vega default.
config	axisBand	grid	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if grid lines should be included as part of the axisDefault value: true for  quantitative fields that are not binned and  time fields  otherwise, false.
config	axisBand	gridColor	Definition:  Color of gridlines.
config	axisBand	gridDash	Definition:  The offset in pixels into which to begin drawing with the grid dash array.
config	axisBand	gridDash	items	Definition:  None
config	axisBand	gridOpacity	Definition:  The stroke opacity of grid value between ,Default value:  by default
config	axisBand	gridWidth	Definition:  The grid width, in pixels.
config	axisBand	labelAngle	Definition:  The rotation angle of the axis labels.Default value: - for time or ordinal axis and  otherwise.
config	axisBand	labelColor	Definition:  The color of the tick label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	axisBand	labelFont	Definition:  The font of the tick label.
config	axisBand	labelFontSize	Definition:  The font size of the label, in pixels.Default value: .
config	axisBand	labelLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis tick labels.
config	axisBand	labels	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if labels should be included as part of the axis default true.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs labels true by default.
config	axisBand	maxExtent	Definition:  The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.
config	axisBand	minExtent	Definition:  The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.
config	axisBand	shortTimeLabels	Definition:  Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.Default value:  false
config	axisBand	tickColor	Definition:  The color of the axiss tick.
config	axisBand	tickSize	Definition:  The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs tickSize  by default.
config	axisBand	tickWidth	Definition:  The width, in pixels, of ticks.
config	axisBand	ticks	Definition:  Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.
config	axisBand	titleColor	Definition:  Color of the title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	axisBand	titleFont	Definition:  Font of the title. e.g., Helvetica Neue.
config	axisBand	titleFontSize	Definition:  Font size of the title.Default value: .
config	axisBand	titleFontWeight	Definition:  Font weight of the title. e.g., bold.
config	axisBand	titleLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis titles.
config	axisBand	titleMaxLength	Definition:  Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the fields description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.Default value:  automatically determined based on the cell size config.cell.width, config.cell.height
config	axisBand	titlePadding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between title and axis.

config	axixBottom	labelFontSize	Definition:  The font size of the label, in pixels.Default value: .
config	axixBottom	labelLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis tick labels.
config	axixBottom	labels	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if labels should be included as part of the axis default true.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs labels true by default.
config	axixBottom	maxExtent	Definition:  The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.
config	axixBottom	minExtent	Definition:  The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.
config	axixBottom	shortTimeLabels	Definition:  Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.Default value:  false
config	axixBottom	tickColor	Definition:  The color of the axiss tick.
config	axixBottom	tickSize	Definition:  The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs tickSize  by default.
config	axixBottom	tickWidth	Definition:  The width, in pixels, of ticks.
config	axixBottom	ticks	Definition:  Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.
config	axixBottom	titleColor	Definition:  Color of the title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	axixBottom	titleFont	Definition:  Font of the title. e.g., Helvetica Neue.
config	axixBottom	titleFontSize	Definition:  Font size of the title.Default value: .
config	axixBottom	titleFontWeight	Definition:  Font weight of the title. e.g., bold.
config	axixBottom	titleLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis titles.
config	axixBottom	titleMaxLength	Definition:  Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the fields description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.Default value:  automatically determined based on the cell size config.cell.width, config.cell.height
config	axixBottom	titlePadding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between title and axis.
config	background	Definition:  CSS color property to use as the background of visualization.Default value: none transparent
config	bar	Definition:  Bar-Specific Config
config	bar	Definition:  None
config	bar	align	Definition:  None
config	bar	align	Definition:  The horizontal alignment of the text. One of left, right, center.
config	bar	angle	Definition:  The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.
config	bar	baseline	Definition:  None
config	bar	baseline	Definition:  The vertical alignment of the text. One of top, middle, bottom.Default value: middle
config	bar	binSpacing	Definition:  Offset between bar for binned field.  Ideal value for this is either  Preferred by statisticians or  Vega-Lite Default, D example style.Default value: 
config	bar	color	Definition:  Default color.Default value: span stylecolor: bspan b
config	bar	continuousBandSize	Definition:  The default size of the bars on continuous scales.Default value: 
config	bar	discreteBandSize	Definition:  The size of the bars.  If unspecified, the default size is  bandSize-,which provides  pixel offset between bars.
config	bar	dx	Definition:  The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	bar	dy	Definition:  The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	bar	fill	Definition:  Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	bar	fillOpacity	Definition:  The fill opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	bar	filled	Definition:  Whether the marks color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.Default value: true for all marks except point and false for point.Applicable for: bar, point, circle, square, and area marks.
config	bar	font	Definition:  The typeface to set the text in e.g., Helvetica Neue.
config	bar	fontSize	Definition:  The font size, in pixels.
config	bar	fontStyle	Definition:  None
config	bar	fontStyle	Definition:  The font style e.g., italic.
config	bar	fontWeight	Definition:  None
config	bar	fontWeight	Definition:  The font weight e.g., bold.
config	bar	interpolate	Definition:  None
config	bar	interpolate	Definition:  The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:- linear: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.- linear-closed: close the linear segments to form a polygon.- step: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- step-before: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.- step-after: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- basis: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- basis-open: an open B-spline may not intersect the start or end.- basis-closed: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.- cardinal: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- cardinal-open: an open Cardinal spline may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.- cardinal-closed: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.- bundle: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.- monotone: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.
config	bar	opacity	Definition:  The overall opacity value between ,.Default value: . for non-aggregate plots with point, tick, circle, or square marks or layered bar charts and  otherwise.
config	bar	orient	Definition:  None
config	bar	orient	Definition:  The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.The value is either horizontal default or vertical.- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tickshould be applied to x or y dimension.- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the lineif config.sortLineBy is not specified.For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stacktherefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.
config	bar	radius	Definition:  Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties.
config	bar	shape	Definition:  The default symbol shape to use. One of: circle default, square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, or triangle-down, or a custom SVG path.Default value: circle
config	bar	size	Definition:  The pixel area each the pointcirclesquare.For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.Default value: 
config	bar	stroke	Definition:  Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	bar	strokeDash	Definition:  An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.
config	bar	strokeDash	items	Definition:  None
config	bar	strokeDashOffset	Definition:  The offset in pixels into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.
config	bar	strokeOpacity	Definition:  The stroke opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	bar	strokeWidth	Definition:  The stroke width, in pixels.
config	bar	tension	Definition:  Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter for line and area marks.
config	bar	text	Definition:  Placeholder text if the text channel is not specified
config	bar	theta	Definition:  Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties. Values for theta follow the same convention of arc mark startAngle and endAngle properties: angles are measured in radians, with  indicating north.

config	filterInvalid	Definition:  Whether to filter invalid values null and NaN from the data.- By default undefined, only quantitative and temporal fields are filtered.- If set to true, all data items with null values are filtered.- If false, all data items are included. In this case, null values will be interpreted as zeroes.
config	legend	Definition:  Legend Config
config	legend	Definition:  None
config	legend	entryPadding	Definition:  Padding in pixels between legend entries in a symbol legend.
config	legend	gradientHeight	Definition:  The height of the gradient, in pixels.
config	legend	gradientStrokeColor	Definition:  The color of the gradient stroke, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	legend	gradientStrokeWidth	Definition:  The width of the gradient stroke, in pixels.
config	legend	gradientWidth	Definition:  The width of the gradient, in pixels.
config	legend	labelAlign	Definition:  The alignment of the legend label, can be left, middle or right.
config	legend	labelBaseline	Definition:  The position of the baseline of legend label, can be top, middle or bottom.
config	legend	labelColor	Definition:  The color of the legend label, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	legend	labelFont	Definition:  The font of the legend label.
config	legend	labelFontSize	Definition:  The font size of legend label.Default value: .
config	legend	labelLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis tick labels.
config	legend	labelOffset	Definition:  The offset of the legend label.
config	legend	offset	Definition:  The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the legend from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.Default value:  
config	legend	orient	Definition:  The orientation of the legend. One of left or right. This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is right.Default value:  right
config	legend	padding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between the legend and axis.
config	legend	shortTimeLabels	Definition:  Whether month names and weekday names should be abbreviated.Default value:  false
config	legend	symbolColor	Definition:  The color of the legend symbol,
config	legend	symbolSize	Definition:  The size of the legend symbol, in pixels.
config	legend	symbolStrokeWidth	Definition:  The width of the symbols stroke.
config	legend	symbolType	Definition:  Default shape type such as circle for legend symbols.
config	legend	titleColor	Definition:  Optional mark property definitions for custom legend styling.The color of the legend title, can be in hex color code or regular color name.
config	legend	titleFont	Definition:  The font of the legend title.
config	legend	titleFontSize	Definition:  The font size of the legend title.
config	legend	titleFontWeight	Definition:  The font weight of the legend title.
config	legend	titleLimit	Definition:  Maximum allowed pixel width of axis titles.
config	legend	titlePadding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between title and legend.
config	line	Definition:  Line-Specific Config
config	line	Definition:  None
config	line	align	Definition:  None
config	line	align	Definition:  The horizontal alignment of the text. One of left, right, center.
config	line	angle	Definition:  The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.
config	line	baseline	Definition:  None
config	line	baseline	Definition:  The vertical alignment of the text. One of top, middle, bottom.Default value: middle
config	line	color	Definition:  Default color.Default value: span stylecolor: bspan b
config	line	dx	Definition:  The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	line	dy	Definition:  The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	line	fill	Definition:  Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	line	fillOpacity	Definition:  The fill opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	line	filled	Definition:  Whether the marks color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.Default value: true for all marks except point and false for point.Applicable for: bar, point, circle, square, and area marks.
config	line	font	Definition:  The typeface to set the text in e.g., Helvetica Neue.
config	line	fontSize	Definition:  The font size, in pixels.
config	line	fontStyle	Definition:  None
config	line	fontStyle	Definition:  The font style e.g., italic.
config	line	fontWeight	Definition:  None
config	line	fontWeight	Definition:  The font weight e.g., bold.
config	line	interpolate	Definition:  None
config	line	interpolate	Definition:  The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:- linear: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.- linear-closed: close the linear segments to form a polygon.- step: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- step-before: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.- step-after: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- basis: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- basis-open: an open B-spline may not intersect the start or end.- basis-closed: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.- cardinal: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- cardinal-open: an open Cardinal spline may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.- cardinal-closed: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.- bundle: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.- monotone: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.
config	line	opacity	Definition:  The overall opacity value between ,.Default value: . for non-aggregate plots with point, tick, circle, or square marks or layered bar charts and  otherwise.
config	line	orient	Definition:  None
config	line	orient	Definition:  The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.The value is either horizontal default or vertical.- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tickshould be applied to x or y dimension.- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the lineif config.sortLineBy is not specified.For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stacktherefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.
config	line	radius	Definition:  Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties.
config	line	shape	Definition:  The default symbol shape to use. One of: circle default, square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, or triangle-down, or a custom SVG path.Default value: circle
config	line	size	Definition:  The pixel area each the pointcirclesquare.For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.Default value: 
config	line	stroke	Definition:  Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	line	strokeDash	Definition:  An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.
config	line	strokeDash	items	Definition:  None
config	line	strokeDashOffset	Definition:  The offset in pixels into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.
config	line	strokeOpacity	Definition:  The stroke opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	line	strokeWidth	Definition:  The stroke width, in pixels.
config	line	tension	Definition:  Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter for line and area marks.
config	line	text	Definition:  Placeholder text if the text channel is not specified
config	line	theta	Definition:  Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties. Values for theta follow the same convention of arc mark startAngle and endAngle properties: angles are measured in radians, with  indicating north.

config	scale	Definition:  None
config	scale	Definition:  Scale Config
config	scale	bandPaddingInner	Definition:  Default inner padding for x and y band-ordinal scales.Default value: .
config	scale	bandPaddingOuter	Definition:  Default outer padding for x and y band-ordinal scales.If not specified, by default, band scales paddingOuter is paddingInner.
config	scale	clamp	Definition:  If true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value
config	scale	maxBandSize	Definition:  The default max value for mapping quantitative fields to bars sizebandSize.If undefined default, we will use bandSize - .
config	scale	maxFontSize	Definition:  The default max value for mapping quantitative fields to texts sizefontSize.If undefined default, we will use bandSize - .Default value: 
config	scale	maxOpacity	Definition:  Default max opacity for mapping a field to opacity.Default value: .
config	scale	maxSize	Definition:  Default max value for point size scale.
config	scale	maxStrokeWidth	Definition:  Default max strokeWidth for strokeWidth  or rulelines size scale.Default value: 
config	scale	minBandSize	Definition:  The default min value for mapping quantitative fields to bar and ticks sizebandSize scale with zerofalseIf undefined default, we will use the continuousBandSize value for bar and  for ticks.
config	scale	minFontSize	Definition:  The default min value for mapping quantitative fields to ticks sizefontSize scale with zerofalseDefault value: 
config	scale	minOpacity	Definition:  Default minimum opacity for mapping a field to opacity.Default value: .
config	scale	minSize	Definition:  Default minimum value for point size scale with zerofalse.Default value: 
config	scale	minStrokeWidth	Definition:  Default minimum strokeWidth for strokeWidth or rulelines size scale with zerofalse.Default value: 
config	scale	pointPadding	Definition:  Default outer padding for x and y point-ordinal scales.Default value: .
config	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  Default range step for  y ordinal scale,and  x ordinal scale when the mark is not text.Default value: 
config	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  None
config	scale	round	Definition:  If true, rounds numeric output values to integers.This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.Only available for x, y, size, row, and column scales.
config	scale	shapes	Definition:  The default collection of symbol shapes for mapping nominal fields to shapes of point marks i.e., range of a shape scale.Each value should be one of: circle, square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, or triangle-down, or a custom SVG path.Default value: circle, square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, triangle-down
config	scale	shapes	items	Definition:  None
config	scale	textXRangeStep	Definition:  Default range step for x ordinal scale when is mark is text.Default value: 
config	scale	useUnaggregatedDomain	Definition:  Use the source data range before aggregation as scale domain instead of aggregated data for aggregate axis.This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain mean, average, median, q, q, min, max. For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain e.g. count, sum, this property is ignored.
config	selection	Definition:  None
config	selection	Definition:  Selection Config
config	selection	interval	Definition:  None
config	selection	interval	bind	Definition:  None
config	selection	interval	bind	element	Definition:  None

config	square	Definition:  None
config	square	Definition:  Square-Specific Config
config	square	align	Definition:  None
config	square	align	Definition:  The horizontal alignment of the text. One of left, right, center.
config	square	angle	Definition:  The rotation angle of the text, in degrees.
config	square	baseline	Definition:  None
config	square	baseline	Definition:  The vertical alignment of the text. One of top, middle, bottom.Default value: middle
config	square	color	Definition:  Default color.Default value: span stylecolor: bspan b
config	square	dx	Definition:  The horizontal offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	square	dy	Definition:  The vertical offset, in pixels, between the text label and its anchor point. The offset is applied after rotation by the angle property.
config	square	fill	Definition:  Default Fill Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	square	fillOpacity	Definition:  The fill opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	square	filled	Definition:  Whether the marks color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.Default value: true for all marks except point and false for point.Applicable for: bar, point, circle, square, and area marks.
config	square	font	Definition:  The typeface to set the text in e.g., Helvetica Neue.
config	square	fontSize	Definition:  The font size, in pixels.
config	square	fontStyle	Definition:  None
config	square	fontStyle	Definition:  The font style e.g., italic.
config	square	fontWeight	Definition:  None
config	square	fontWeight	Definition:  The font weight e.g., bold.
config	square	interpolate	Definition:  None
config	square	interpolate	Definition:  The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:- linear: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.- linear-closed: close the linear segments to form a polygon.- step: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- step-before: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.- step-after: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- basis: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- basis-open: an open B-spline may not intersect the start or end.- basis-closed: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.- cardinal: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- cardinal-open: an open Cardinal spline may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.- cardinal-closed: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.- bundle: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.- monotone: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.
config	square	opacity	Definition:  The overall opacity value between ,.Default value: . for non-aggregate plots with point, tick, circle, or square marks or layered bar charts and  otherwise.
config	square	orient	Definition:  None
config	square	orient	Definition:  The orientation of a non-stacked bar, tick, area, and line charts.The value is either horizontal default or vertical.- For bar, rule and tick, this determines whether the size of the bar and tickshould be applied to x or y dimension.- For area, this property determines the orient property of the Vega output.- For line, this property determines the sort order of the points in the lineif config.sortLineBy is not specified.For stacked charts, this is always determined by the orientation of the stacktherefore explicitly specified value will be ignored.
config	square	radius	Definition:  Polar coordinate radial offset, in pixels, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties.
config	square	shape	Definition:  The default symbol shape to use. One of: circle default, square, cross, diamond, triangle-up, or triangle-down, or a custom SVG path.Default value: circle
config	square	size	Definition:  The pixel area each the pointcirclesquare.For example: in the case of circles, the radius is determined in part by the square root of the size value.Default value: 
config	square	stroke	Definition:  Default Stroke Color.  This has higher precedence than config.colorDefault value: None
config	square	strokeDash	Definition:  An array of alternating stroke, space lengths for creating dashed or dotted lines.
config	square	strokeDash	items	Definition:  None
config	square	strokeDashOffset	Definition:  The offset in pixels into which to begin drawing with the stroke dash array.
config	square	strokeOpacity	Definition:  The stroke opacity value between ,.Default value: 
config	square	strokeWidth	Definition:  The stroke width, in pixels.
config	square	tension	Definition:  Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter for line and area marks.
config	square	text	Definition:  Placeholder text if the text channel is not specified
config	square	theta	Definition:  Polar coordinate angle, in radians, of the text label from the origin determined by the x and y properties. Values for theta follow the same convention of arc mark startAngle and endAngle properties: angles are measured in radians, with  indicating north.

config	timeFormat	Definition:  Default datetime format for axis and legend labels. The format can be set directly on each axis and legend. D time format patternhttps:github.commbostockdwikiTime-Formatting.Default value: b d, Y.
data	Definition:  An object describing the data source
data	Definition:  None
data	format	Definition:  None
data	format	Definition:  Parsing properties.
data	format	Definition:  Type of input data: json, csv, tsv. The default format type is determined by the extension of the file URL. If no extension is detected, json will be used by default.
data	format	feature	Definition:  The name of the TopoJSON object set to convert to a GeoJSON feature collection.For example, in a map of the world, there may be an object set named countries.Using the feature property, we can extract this set and generate a GeoJSON feature object for each country.
data	format	mesh	Definition:  The name of the TopoJSON object set to convert to mesh.Similar to the feature option, mesh extracts a named TopoJSON object set.  Unlike the feature option, the corresponding geo data is returned as a single, unified mesh instance, not as individual GeoJSON features.Extracting a mesh is useful for more efficiently drawing borders or other geographic elements that you do not need to associate with specific regions such as individual countries, states or counties.
data	format	parse	Definition:  A collection of parsing instructions can be used to define the data types of string-valued attributes in the JSON file. Each instruction is a name-value pair, where the name is the name of the attribute, and the value is the desired data type one of number, boolean or date. For example, parse: modifiedon:date ensures that the modifiedon value in each row of the input data is parsed as a Date value. See Datalibs dl.read.types methodhttps:github.comvegadatalibwikiImportdlreadtypes for more information.
data	format	property	Definition:  JSON only The JSON property containing the desired data.This parameter can be used when the loaded JSON file may have surrounding structure or meta-data.For example property: values.features is equivalent to retrieving json.values.featuresfrom the loaded JSON object.
data	format	type	Definition:  None
data	format	type	Definition:  Type of input data: json, csv, tsv.The default format type is determined by the extension of the file URL.If no extension is detected, json will be used by default.
data	name	Definition:  Provide a placeholder name and bind data at runtime.
data	url	Definition:  An URL from which to load the data set. Use the format.type propertyto ensure the loaded data is correctly parsed.
data	values	Definition:  Pass array of objects instead of a url to a file.
data	values	items	Definition:  None
description	Definition:  An optional description of this mark for commenting purpose.
encoding	Definition:  A key-value mapping between encoding channels and definition of fields.
encoding	Definition:  None
encoding	color	Definition:  Color of the marks  either fill or stroke color based on mark type.By default, fill color for area, bar, tick, text, circle, and square stroke color for line and point.
encoding	color	Definition:  None
encoding	color	aggregate	Definition:  Aggregation function for the fielde.g., mean, sum, median, min, max, count.Default value: undefined None
encoding	color	bin	Definition:  Binning properties or boolean flag for determining whether to bin data or not.
encoding	color	bin	Definition:  Flag for binning a quantitative field, or a bin property objectfor binning parameters.
encoding	color	bin	Definition:  None
encoding	color	bin	base	Definition:  The number base to use for automatic bin determination default is base .Default value: 
encoding	color	bin	divide	Definition:  Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is , , which indicates that for base  numbers the default base, the method may consider dividing bin sizes by  andor . For example, for an initial step size of , the method can check if bin sizes of   ,   , or    might also satisfy the given constraints.Default value: , 
encoding	color	bin	divide	items	Definition:  None
encoding	color	bin	extent	Definition:  A two-element min, max array indicating the range of desired bin values.
encoding	color	bin	extent	items	Definition:  None
encoding	color	bin	maxbins	Definition:  Maximum number of bins.Default value:  for row, column and shape channels  for other channels
encoding	color	bin	minstep	Definition:  A minimum allowable step size particularly useful for integer values.
encoding	color	bin	nice	Definition:  If true the default, attempts to make the bin boundaries use human-friendly boundaries, such as multiples of ten.
encoding	color	bin	step	Definition:  An exact step size to use between bins.Note: If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.
encoding	color	bin	steps	Definition:  An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.
encoding	color	bin	steps	items	Definition:  None
encoding	color	condition	Definition:  None
encoding	color	condition	selection	Definition:  None
encoding	color	condition	value	Definition:  None
encoding	color	field	Definition:  None
encoding	color	field	Definition:  Required. Name of the field from which to pull a data value.Note: field is not required if aggregate is count.
encoding	color	field	repeat	Definition:  None
encoding	color	legend	Definition:  None
encoding	color	legend	Definition:  Properties of a legend or boolean flag for determining whether to show it.
encoding	color	legend	encode	Definition:  None

encoding	color	legend	encode	gradient	Definition:  None

encoding	color	legend	encode	legend	Definition:  None
encoding	color	legend	encode	symbols	Definition:  None
encoding	color	legend	encode	title	Definition:  None
encoding	color	legend	entryPadding	Definition:  Padding in pixels between legend entries in a symbol legend.
encoding	color	legend	format	Definition:  The formatting pattern for labels. This is Ds number format patternhttps:github.commbostockdwikiFormatting for quantitative fields and Ds time format patternhttps:github.commbostockdwikiTime-Formatting for time field.Default value:  derived from numberFormatconfig.htmlformat config for quantitative fields and from timeFormatconfig.htmlformat config for temporal fields.
encoding	color	legend	offset	Definition:  The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the legend from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.Default value:  
encoding	color	legend	orient	Definition:  The orientation of the legend. One of left or right. This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is right.Default value:  right
encoding	color	legend	padding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between the legend and axis.
encoding	color	legend	tickCount	Definition:  The desired number of tick values for quantitative legends.
encoding	color	legend	title	Definition:  A title for the field.Default value:  derived from the fields name and transformation function applied e.g, fieldname, SUMfieldname, BINfieldname, YEARfieldname.
encoding	color	legend	type	Definition:  The type of the legend. Use symbol to create a discrete legend and gradient for a continuous color gradient.
encoding	color	legend	values	Definition:  Explicitly set the visible legend values.
encoding	color	legend	values	Definition:  None
encoding	color	legend	values	items	Definition:  None
encoding	color	legend	values	items	Definition:  Object for defining datetime in Vega-Lite Filter.If both month and quarter are provided, month has higher precedence.day cannot be combined with other date.We accept string for month and day names.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	date	Definition:  Integer value representing the date from -.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	day	Definition:  Value representing the day of a week.  This can be one of:  integer value --  represents Monday  case-insensitive day name e.g., Monday   case-insensitive, -character short day name e.g., Mon.   br Warning: A DateTime definition object with day should not be combined with year, quarter, month, or date.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	hours	Definition:  Integer value representing the hour of a day from -.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	milliseconds	Definition:  Integer value representing the millisecond segment of time.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	minutes	Definition:  Integer value representing the minute segment of time from -.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	month	Definition:  One of:  integer value representing the month from -.  represents January   case-insensitive month name e.g., January   case-insensitive, -character short month name e.g., Jan.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	quarter	Definition:  Integer value representing the quarter of the year from -.
encoding	color	legend	values	items	seconds	Definition:  Integer value representing the second segment - of a time value
encoding	color	legend	values	items	year	Definition:  Integer value representing the year.
encoding	color	legend	zindex	Definition:  A non-positive integer indicating z-index of the legend.If zindex is , legend should be drawn behind all chart elements.To put them in front, use zindex  .
encoding	color	scale	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	clamp	Definition:  If true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range valueDefault value: derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-config true by defaultSupported types: only linear, pow, sqrt, and log Not applicable for quantile, quantize, and threshold scales as they output discrete ranges.
encoding	color	scale	domain	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	domain	Definition:  The domain of the scale, representing the set of data values. For quantitative data, this can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinalcategorical data, this may be an array of valid input values.If the domain is unaggregated, we use the source data range before aggregation as scale domain instead of aggregated data for an aggregate axis.This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain mean, average, median, q, q, min, max. For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain e.g. count, sum, this property is ignored.
encoding	color	scale	domain	encoding	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	domain	field	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	Definition:  Object for defining datetime in Vega-Lite Filter.If both month and quarter are provided, month has higher precedence.day cannot be combined with other date.We accept string for month and day names.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	date	Definition:  Integer value representing the date from -.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	day	Definition:  Value representing the day of a week.  This can be one of:  integer value --  represents Monday  case-insensitive day name e.g., Monday   case-insensitive, -character short day name e.g., Mon.   br Warning: A DateTime definition object with day should not be combined with year, quarter, month, or date.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	hours	Definition:  Integer value representing the hour of a day from -.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	milliseconds	Definition:  Integer value representing the millisecond segment of time.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	minutes	Definition:  Integer value representing the minute segment of time from -.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	month	Definition:  One of:  integer value representing the month from -.  represents January   case-insensitive month name e.g., January   case-insensitive, -character short month name e.g., Jan.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	quarter	Definition:  Integer value representing the quarter of the year from -.
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	seconds	Definition:  Integer value representing the second segment - of a time value
encoding	color	scale	domain	items	year	Definition:  Integer value representing the year.
encoding	color	scale	domain	selection	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	domain	signal	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	exponent	Definition:  Sets the exponent of the scale transformation. For pow scale types only, otherwise ignored.
encoding	color	scale	interpolate	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	nice	Definition:  As quantitative scale property, if specified, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. If specified as a true boolean, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly number range e.g.,  instead of .. If specified as a string, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. For time and utc scale types only, the nice value should be a string indicating the desired time interval.As time scale properties, if true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value. Not applicable for quantile, quantize, and threshold scales as they output discrete ranges.Default value: true only for quantitative x and y scales and false otherwise.
encoding	color	scale	padding	Definition:  Applies spacing among ordinal elements in the scale range. The actual effect depends on how the scale is configured. If the points parameter is true, the padding value is interpreted as a multiple of the spacing between points. A reasonable value is ., such that the first and last point will be offset from the minimum and maximum value by half the distance between points. Otherwise, padding is typically in the range ,  and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of . means that the band size will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the D ordinal scale documentationhttps:github.commbostockdwikiOrdinal-Scales.A convenience property for setting the inner and outer padding to the same value.Default value: x and y channels are derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs pointPadding for point scale and bandPadding for band scale.  Other channels have  padding by default.
encoding	color	scale	paddingInner	Definition:  The inner padding of a band scale determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space between bands. For point scale, this property is ignored.
encoding	color	scale	paddingOuter	Definition:  The outer padding determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space before the first and after the last bandspoints.
encoding	color	scale	range	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	range	Definition:  The range of the scale, representing the set of visual values. For numeric values, the range can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinal or quantized data, the range may by an array of desired output values, which are mapped to elements in the specified domain.
encoding	color	scale	range	items	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  The distance between the starts of adjacent bands or points in band or point scales.If this value is null, this will be determined to fit width for x or height for y of the plot.If both width and x-scales rangeStep is provided, rangeStep will be dropped.  The same rule is applied for height and y-scales rangeStep.Default Rule: for x ordinal scale of a text mark, derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs textXRangeStep. Otherwise, derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs rangeStep.Warning: If the cardinality of the scale domain is too high, the rangeStep might become less than one pixel and the mark might not appear correctly.
encoding	color	scale	round	Definition:  If true, rounds numeric output values to integers. This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.Default Rule: true for x, y, row, column channels if scale configs round is true false otherwise.
encoding	color	scale	scheme	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	scheme	Definition:  Range scheme e.g., color schemes such as category or viridis.Default value: scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs nominalColorScheme for nominal field and sequentialColorScheme for other types of fields.
encoding	color	scale	scheme	count	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	scheme	extent	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	scheme	extent	items	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	scheme	name	Definition:  Color scheme that determines output color of an ordinalsequential color scale.
encoding	color	scale	type	Definition:  None
encoding	color	scale	type	Definition:  The type of scale.- For a quantitative field, supported quantitative scale types  are linear default, log, pow, sqrt, quantile, quantize, and threshold.- For a temporal field without timeUnit, the scale type should be time default or ordinal.- For ordinal and nominal fields, the type is always ordinal.Unsupported values will be ignored.
encoding	color	scale	zero	Definition:  If true, ensures that a zero baseline value is included in the scale domain.Default value: true for x and y channel if the quantitative field is not binnedand no custom domain is provided false otherwise.Default value: true for x and y channel if the quantitative field is not binned and no custom domain is provided false otherwise.Note:  This property is always false for log scale.
encoding	color	sort	Definition:  None
encoding	color	sort	Definition:  Sort order for a particular field.For quantitative or temporal fields, this can be either ascending or descendingFor quantitative or temporal fields, this can be ascending, descending, none, or a sort field definition objectsort.htmlsort-field for sorting by an aggregate calculation of a specified sort field.Default value: ascending
encoding	color	sort	field	Definition:  The field name to aggregate over.
encoding	color	sort	op	Definition:  None
encoding	color	sort	op	Definition:  The sort aggregation operator
encoding	color	sort	order	Definition:  None
encoding	color	timeUnit	Definition:  None
encoding	color	timeUnit	Definition:  Time unit for a temporal field  e.g., year, yearmonth, month, hour.Default value: undefined None
encoding	color	type	Definition:  None
encoding	color	type	Definition:  The encoded fields type of measurement. This can be either a full typename quantitative, temporal, ordinal,  and nominalor an initial character of the type name Q, T, O, N.This property is case-insensitive.
encoding	color	value	Definition:  A constant value in visual domain.

encoding	opacity	scale	domain	Definition:  None
encoding	opacity	scale	domain	Definition:  The domain of the scale, representing the set of data values. For quantitative data, this can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinalcategorical data, this may be an array of valid input values.If the domain is unaggregated, we use the source data range before aggregation as scale domain instead of aggregated data for an aggregate axis.This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain mean, average, median, q, q, min, max. For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain e.g. count, sum, this property is ignored.

encoding	opacity	scale	interpolate	Definition:  None
encoding	opacity	scale	nice	Definition:  As quantitative scale property, if specified, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. If specified as a true boolean, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly number range e.g.,  instead of .. If specified as a string, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. For time and utc scale types only, the nice value should be a string indicating the desired time interval.As time scale properties, if true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value. Not applicable for quantile, quantize, and threshold scales as they output discrete ranges.Default value: true only for quantitative x and y scales and false otherwise.
encoding	opacity	scale	padding	Definition:  Applies spacing among ordinal elements in the scale range. The actual effect depends on how the scale is configured. If the points parameter is true, the padding value is interpreted as a multiple of the spacing between points. A reasonable value is ., such that the first and last point will be offset from the minimum and maximum value by half the distance between points. Otherwise, padding is typically in the range ,  and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of . means that the band size will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the D ordinal scale documentationhttps:github.commbostockdwikiOrdinal-Scales.A convenience property for setting the inner and outer padding to the same value.Default value: x and y channels are derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs pointPadding for point scale and bandPadding for band scale.  Other channels have  padding by default.

encoding	order	items	bin	nice	Definition:  If true the default, attempts to make the bin boundaries use human-friendly boundaries, such as multiples of ten.
encoding	order	items	bin	step	Definition:  An exact step size to use between bins.Note: If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.

encoding	shape	scale	domain	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	domain	Definition:  The domain of the scale, representing the set of data values. For quantitative data, this can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinalcategorical data, this may be an array of valid input values.If the domain is unaggregated, we use the source data range before aggregation as scale domain instead of aggregated data for an aggregate axis.This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain mean, average, median, q, q, min, max. For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain e.g. count, sum, this property is ignored.

encoding	shape	scale	domain	items	year	Definition:  Integer value representing the year.
encoding	shape	scale	domain	selection	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	domain	signal	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	exponent	Definition:  Sets the exponent of the scale transformation. For pow scale types only, otherwise ignored.
encoding	shape	scale	interpolate	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	nice	Definition:  As quantitative scale property, if specified, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. If specified as a true boolean, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly number range e.g.,  instead of .. If specified as a string, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. For time and utc scale types only, the nice value should be a string indicating the desired time interval.As time scale properties, if true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value. Not applicable for quantile, quantize, and threshold scales as they output discrete ranges.Default value: true only for quantitative x and y scales and false otherwise.
encoding	shape	scale	padding	Definition:  Applies spacing among ordinal elements in the scale range. The actual effect depends on how the scale is configured. If the points parameter is true, the padding value is interpreted as a multiple of the spacing between points. A reasonable value is ., such that the first and last point will be offset from the minimum and maximum value by half the distance between points. Otherwise, padding is typically in the range ,  and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of . means that the band size will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the D ordinal scale documentationhttps:github.commbostockdwikiOrdinal-Scales.A convenience property for setting the inner and outer padding to the same value.Default value: x and y channels are derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs pointPadding for point scale and bandPadding for band scale.  Other channels have  padding by default.
encoding	shape	scale	paddingInner	Definition:  The inner padding of a band scale determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space between bands. For point scale, this property is ignored.
encoding	shape	scale	paddingOuter	Definition:  The outer padding determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space before the first and after the last bandspoints.
encoding	shape	scale	range	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	range	Definition:  The range of the scale, representing the set of visual values. For numeric values, the range can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinal or quantized data, the range may by an array of desired output values, which are mapped to elements in the specified domain.
encoding	shape	scale	range	items	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  The distance between the starts of adjacent bands or points in band or point scales.If this value is null, this will be determined to fit width for x or height for y of the plot.If both width and x-scales rangeStep is provided, rangeStep will be dropped.  The same rule is applied for height and y-scales rangeStep.Default Rule: for x ordinal scale of a text mark, derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs textXRangeStep. Otherwise, derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs rangeStep.Warning: If the cardinality of the scale domain is too high, the rangeStep might become less than one pixel and the mark might not appear correctly.
encoding	shape	scale	round	Definition:  If true, rounds numeric output values to integers. This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.Default Rule: true for x, y, row, column channels if scale configs round is true false otherwise.
encoding	shape	scale	scheme	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	scheme	Definition:  Range scheme e.g., color schemes such as category or viridis.Default value: scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs nominalColorScheme for nominal field and sequentialColorScheme for other types of fields.

encoding	shape	scale	type	Definition:  None
encoding	shape	scale	type	Definition:  The type of scale.- For a quantitative field, supported quantitative scale types  are linear default, log, pow, sqrt, quantile, quantize, and threshold.- For a temporal field without timeUnit, the scale type should be time default or ordinal.- For ordinal and nominal fields, the type is always ordinal.Unsupported values will be ignored.
encoding	shape	scale	zero	Definition:  If true, ensures that a zero baseline value is included in the scale domain.Default value: true for x and y channel if the quantitative field is not binnedand no custom domain is provided false otherwise.Default value: true for x and y channel if the quantitative field is not binned and no custom domain is provided false otherwise.Note:  This property is always false for log scale.

encoding	size	scale	padding	Definition:  Applies spacing among ordinal elements in the scale range. The actual effect depends on how the scale is configured. If the points parameter is true, the padding value is interpreted as a multiple of the spacing between points. A reasonable value is ., such that the first and last point will be offset from the minimum and maximum value by half the distance between points. Otherwise, padding is typically in the range ,  and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of . means that the band size will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the D ordinal scale documentationhttps:github.commbostockdwikiOrdinal-Scales.A convenience property for setting the inner and outer padding to the same value.Default value: x and y channels are derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs pointPadding for point scale and bandPadding for band scale.  Other channels have  padding by default.
encoding	size	scale	paddingInner	Definition:  The inner padding of a band scale determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space between bands. For point scale, this property is ignored.
encoding	size	scale	paddingOuter	Definition:  The outer padding determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space before the first and after the last bandspoints.
encoding	size	scale	range	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	range	Definition:  The range of the scale, representing the set of visual values. For numeric values, the range can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinal or quantized data, the range may by an array of desired output values, which are mapped to elements in the specified domain.
encoding	size	scale	range	items	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	rangeStep	Definition:  The distance between the starts of adjacent bands or points in band or point scales.If this value is null, this will be determined to fit width for x or height for y of the plot.If both width and x-scales rangeStep is provided, rangeStep will be dropped.  The same rule is applied for height and y-scales rangeStep.Default Rule: for x ordinal scale of a text mark, derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs textXRangeStep. Otherwise, derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs rangeStep.Warning: If the cardinality of the scale domain is too high, the rangeStep might become less than one pixel and the mark might not appear correctly.
encoding	size	scale	round	Definition:  If true, rounds numeric output values to integers. This can be helpful for snapping to the pixel grid.Default Rule: true for x, y, row, column channels if scale configs round is true false otherwise.
encoding	size	scale	scheme	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	scheme	Definition:  Range scheme e.g., color schemes such as category or viridis.Default value: scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs nominalColorScheme for nominal field and sequentialColorScheme for other types of fields.
encoding	size	scale	scheme	count	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	scheme	extent	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	scheme	extent	items	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	scheme	name	Definition:  Color scheme that determines output color of an ordinalsequential color scale.
encoding	size	scale	type	Definition:  None
encoding	size	scale	type	Definition:  The type of scale.- For a quantitative field, supported quantitative scale types  are linear default, log, pow, sqrt, quantile, quantize, and threshold.- For a temporal field without timeUnit, the scale type should be time default or ordinal.- For ordinal and nominal fields, the type is always ordinal.Unsupported values will be ignored.
encoding	size	scale	zero	Definition:  If true, ensures that a zero baseline value is included in the scale domain.Default value: true for x and y channel if the quantitative field is not binnedand no custom domain is provided false otherwise.Default value: true for x and y channel if the quantitative field is not binned and no custom domain is provided false otherwise.Note:  This property is always false for log scale.
encoding	size	sort	Definition:  None
encoding	size	sort	Definition:  Sort order for a particular field.For quantitative or temporal fields, this can be either ascending or descendingFor quantitative or temporal fields, this can be ascending, descending, none, or a sort field definition objectsort.htmlsort-field for sorting by an aggregate calculation of a specified sort field.Default value: ascending
encoding	size	sort	field	Definition:  The field name to aggregate over.
encoding	size	sort	op	Definition:  None
encoding	size	sort	op	Definition:  The sort aggregation operator
encoding	size	sort	order	Definition:  None
encoding	size	timeUnit	Definition:  None
encoding	size	timeUnit	Definition:  Time unit for a temporal field  e.g., year, yearmonth, month, hour.Default value: undefined None
encoding	size	type	Definition:  None
encoding	size	type	Definition:  The encoded fields type of measurement. This can be either a full typename quantitative, temporal, ordinal,  and nominalor an initial character of the type name Q, T, O, N.This property is case-insensitive.
encoding	size	value	Definition:  A constant value in visual domain.

The default value is , , which indicates that for base  numbers the default base, the method may consider dividing bin sizes by  andor . For example, for an initial step size of , the method can check if bin sizes of   ,   , or    might also satisfy the given constraints.Default value: ,

encoding	x	axis	orient	Definition:  The orientation of the axis. One of top, bottom, left or right. The orientation can be used to further specialize the axis type e.g., a y axis oriented for the right edge of the chart.Default value: x axis is placed on the bottom, y axis is placed on the left, columns x-axis is placed on the top, rows y-axis is placed on the right.

encoding	x	scale	clamp	Definition:  If true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range valueDefault value: derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-config true by defaultSupported types: only linear, pow, sqrt, and log Not applicable for quantile, quantize, and threshold scales as they output discrete ranges.
encoding	x	scale	domain	Definition:  None
encoding	x	scale	domain	Definition:  The domain of the scale, representing the set of data values. For quantitative data, this can take the form of a two-element array with minimum and maximum values. For ordinalcategorical data, this may be an array of valid input values.If the domain is unaggregated, we use the source data range before aggregation as scale domain instead of aggregated data for an aggregate axis.This property only works with aggregate functions that produce values within the raw data domain mean, average, median, q, q, min, max. For other aggregations that produce values outside of the raw data domain e.g. count, sum, this property is ignored.

encoding	x	scale	exponent	Definition:  Sets the exponent of the scale transformation. For pow scale types only, otherwise ignored.
encoding	x	scale	interpolate	Definition:  None
encoding	x	scale	nice	Definition:  As quantitative scale property, if specified, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. If specified as a true boolean, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly number range e.g.,  instead of .. If specified as a string, modifies the scale domain to use a more human-friendly value range. For time and utc scale types only, the nice value should be a string indicating the desired time interval.As time scale properties, if true, values that exceed the data domain are clamped to either the minimum or maximum range value. Not applicable for quantile, quantize, and threshold scales as they output discrete ranges.Default value: true only for quantitative x and y scales and false otherwise.
encoding	x	scale	padding	Definition:  Applies spacing among ordinal elements in the scale range. The actual effect depends on how the scale is configured. If the points parameter is true, the padding value is interpreted as a multiple of the spacing between points. A reasonable value is ., such that the first and last point will be offset from the minimum and maximum value by half the distance between points. Otherwise, padding is typically in the range ,  and corresponds to the fraction of space in the range interval to allocate to padding. A value of . means that the band size will be equal to the padding width. For more, see the D ordinal scale documentationhttps:github.commbostockdwikiOrdinal-Scales.A convenience property for setting the inner and outer padding to the same value.Default value: x and y channels are derived from scale configconfig.htmlscale-configs pointPadding for point scale and bandPadding for band scale.  Other channels have  padding by default.
encoding	x	scale	paddingInner	Definition:  The inner padding of a band scale determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space between bands. For point scale, this property is ignored.
encoding	x	scale	paddingOuter	Definition:  The outer padding determines the ratio of the range that is reserved for blank space before the first and after the last bandspoints.
encoding	x	scale	range	Definition:  None
encoding	x	scale	range	Definition:  The range of the scale, representing the set of visual values. This is Ds number format patternhttps:github.commbostockdwikiFormatting for quantitative fields and Ds time format patternhttps:github.commbostockdwikiTime-Formatting for time field.Default value:  derived from numberFormatconfig.htmlformat config for quantitative fields and from timeFormatconfig.htmlformat config for temporal fields.
encoding	y	axis	grid	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if grid lines should be included as part of the axisDefault value: true for  quantitative fields that are not binned and  time fields  otherwise, false.
encoding	y	axis	labelAngle	Definition:  The rotation angle of the axis labels.Default value: - for time or ordinal axis and  otherwise.
encoding	y	axis	labelPadding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between axis and text labels.
encoding	y	axis	labels	Definition:  A boolean flag indicating if labels should be included as part of the axis default true.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs labels true by default.
encoding	y	axis	maxExtent	Definition:  The maximum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a maximum offset value for axis titles.
encoding	y	axis	minExtent	Definition:  The minimum extent in pixels that axis ticks and labels should use. This determines a minimum offset value for axis titles.
encoding	y	axis	offset	Definition:  The offset, in pixels, by which to displace the axis from the edge of the enclosing group or data rectangle.Default value: derived from  axis configconfig.htmlfacet-scale-configs offset  by default
encoding	y	axis	orient	Definition:  None
encoding	y	axis	orient	Definition:  The orientation of the axis. One of top, bottom, left or right. The orientation can be used to further specialize the axis type e.g., a y axis oriented for the right edge of the chart.Default value: x axis is placed on the bottom, y axis is placed on the left, columns x-axis is placed on the top, rows y-axis is placed on the right.
encoding	y	axis	position	Definition:  The anchor position of the axis in pixels. For x-axis with top or bottom orientation, this sets the axis group x coordinate. For y-axis with left or right orientation, this sets the axis group y coordinate.Default value: 
encoding	y	axis	tickCount	Definition:  A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are nice multiples of , ,  and lie within the underlying scales range.
encoding	y	axis	tickSize	Definition:  The size, in pixels, of major, minor and end ticks.Default value:  derived from axis configconfig.htmlaxis-configs tickSize  by default.
encoding	y	axis	ticks	Definition:  Boolean value that determines whether the axis should include ticks.
encoding	y	axis	title	Definition:  A title for the field.Default value:  derived from the fields name and transformation function applied e.g, fieldname, SUMfieldname, BINfieldname, YEARfieldname.
encoding	y	axis	titleMaxLength	Definition:  Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the fields description. By default, this is automatically based on cell size and characterWidth property.Default value:  automatically determined based on the cell size config.cell.width, config.cell.height
encoding	y	axis	titlePadding	Definition:  The padding, in pixels, between title and axis.
encoding	y	axis	values	Definition:  Explicitly set the visible axis tick values.
encoding	y	axis	values	Definition:  None
encoding	y	axis	values	items	Definition:  None
encoding	y	axis	values	items	Definition:  Object for defining datetime in Vega-Lite Filter.If both month and quarter are provided, month has higher precedence.day cannot be combined with other date.We accept string for month and day names.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	date	Definition:  Integer value representing the date from -.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	day	Definition:  Value representing the day of a week.  This can be one of:  integer value --  represents Monday  case-insensitive day name e.g., Monday   case-insensitive, -character short day name e.g., Mon.   br Warning: A DateTime definition object with day should not be combined with year, quarter, month, or date.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	hours	Definition:  Integer value representing the hour of a day from -.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	milliseconds	Definition:  Integer value representing the millisecond segment of time.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	minutes	Definition:  Integer value representing the minute segment of time from -.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	month	Definition:  One of:  integer value representing the month from -.  represents January   case-insensitive month name e.g., January   case-insensitive, -character short month name e.g., Jan.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	quarter	Definition:  Integer value representing the quarter of the year from -.
encoding	y	axis	values	items	seconds	Definition:  Integer value representing the second segment - of a time value
encoding	y	axis	values	items	year	Definition:  Integer value representing the year.
encoding	y	axis	zindex	Definition:  A non-positive integer indicating z-index of the axis.If zindex is , axes should be drawn behind all chart elements.To put them in front, use zindex  .Default value:  Behind the marks.
encoding	y	bin	Definition:  Binning properties or boolean flag for determining whether to bin data or not.
