vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	base	Definition:  The number base to use for automatic bin determination default is base .Default value: 
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	divide	Definition:  Scale factors indicating allowable subdivisions. The default value is , , which indicates that for base  numbers the default base, the method may consider dividing bin sizes by  andor . For example, for an initial step size of , the method can check if bin sizes of   ,   , or    might also satisfy the given constraints.Default value: , 
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	divide	items	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	extent	Definition:  A two-element min, max array indicating the range of desired bin values.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	extent	items	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	maxbins	Definition:  Maximum number of bins.Default value:  for row, column and shape channels  for other channels
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	minstep	Definition:  A minimum allowable step size particularly useful for integer values.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	nice	Definition:  If true the default, attempts to make the bin boundaries use human-friendly boundaries, such as multiples of ten.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	step	Definition:  An exact step size to use between bins.Note: If provided, options such as maxbins will be ignored.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	steps	Definition:  An array of allowable step sizes to choose from.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	bin	steps	items	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	field	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	field	Definition:  Required. Name of the field from which to pull a data value.Note: field is not required if aggregate is count.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	field	repeat	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	timeUnit	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	timeUnit	Definition:  Time unit for a temporal field  e.g., year, yearmonth, month, hour.Default value: undefined None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	type	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	type	Definition:  The encoded fields type of measurement. This can be either a full typename quantitative, temporal, ordinal,  and nominalor an initial character of the type name Q, T, O, N.This property is case-insensitive.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	encoding	y	value	Definition:  A constant value in visual domain.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	height	Definition:  Height of a single visualization.Default value:- For y-axis with a continuous non-ordinal scale, the height will be the value of config.cell.heightconfig.htmlcell-config.- For y-axis with an ordinal scale: if rangeStepscale.htmlordinal is a numeric value default, the height is determined by the value of rangeStep and the cardinality of the field mapped to y-channel.   Otherwise, if the rangeStep is fit, the height will be the value of config.cell.heightconfig.htmlcell-config.- If no field is mapped to x channel, the height will be the value of rangeStep.Note: For plot with row and column channels, this represents the height of a single cell.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	Definition:  A string describing the mark type one of bar, circle, square, tick, line,area, point, rule, and text or a mark definition objectmark.htmlmark-def.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	filled	Definition:  Whether the marks color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.Default value: All marks except point, line, and rule are filled by default.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	interpolate	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	interpolate	Definition:  The line interpolation method to use for line and area marks. One of the following:- linear: piecewise linear segments, as in a polyline.- linear-closed: close the linear segments to form a polygon.- step: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- step-before: alternate between vertical and horizontal segments, as in a step function.- step-after: alternate between horizontal and vertical segments, as in a step function.- basis: a B-spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- basis-open: an open B-spline may not intersect the start or end.- basis-closed: a closed B-spline, as in a loop.- cardinal: a Cardinal spline, with control point duplication on the ends.- cardinal-open: an open Cardinal spline may not intersect the start or end, but will intersect other control points.- cardinal-closed: a closed Cardinal spline, as in a loop.- bundle: equivalent to basis, except the tension parameter is used to straighten the spline.- monotone: cubic interpolation that preserves monotonicity in y.For more information about each interpolation method, please see Ds line interpolationhttps:github.commbostockdwikiSVG-Shapeslineinterpolate.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	orient	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	orient	Definition:  TODO
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	role	Definition:  A metadata string indicating the role of the mark.This allows users to use config.role-name. to customize properties of marks with specific roles.In addition, SVG renderers will add this role value prepended with the prefix role- as a CSS class name on the enclosing SVG group g element containing the mark instances.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	tension	Definition:  Depending on the interpolation type, sets the tension parameter for line and area marks.TODO: provide the link to D docs.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	type	Definition:  All types of primitive marks.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	mark	type	Definition:  The mark type.One of bar, circle, square, tick, line,area, point, rule, and text.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	name	Definition:  Name of the visualization for later reference.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	selection	Definition:  A key-value mapping between selection names and definitions.

vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	Definition:  A string containing the filter Vega expression. Use datum to refer to the current data object.

vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	equal	Definition:  None
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	equal	Definition:  Object for defining datetime in Vega-Lite Filter.If both month and quarter are provided, month has higher precedence.day cannot be combined with other date.We accept string for month and day names.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	equal	Definition:  The value that the field should be equal to.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	equal	date	Definition:  Integer value representing the date from -.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	equal	day	Definition:  Value representing the day of a week.  This can be one of:  integer value --  represents Monday  case-insensitive day name e.g., Monday   case-insensitive, -character short day name e.g., Mon.   br Warning: A DateTime definition object with day should not be combined with year, quarter, month, or date.
vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	equal	hours	Definition:  Integer value representing the hour of a day from -.

vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	equal	minutes	Definition:  Integer value representing the minute segment of time from -.

vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	transform	items	filter	oneOf	items	Definition:  None

vconcat	items	spec	layer	items	width	Definition:  The width of a single visualization.Default value: This will be determined by the following rules:- For x-axis with a continuous non-ordinal scale, the width will be the value of config.cell.widthconfig.htmlcell-config.- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if rangeStepscale.htmlordinal is a numeric value default, the width is determined by the value of rangeStep and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the rangeStep is fit, the width will be the value of config.cell.widthconfig.htmlcell-config.- If no field is mapped to x channel, the width will be the value of config.scale.textXRangeStepsize.htmldefault-width-and-height for text mark and the value of rangeStep for other marks.Note: For plot with row and column channels, this represents the width of a single cell.

vconcat	items	width	Definition:  The width of a single visualization.Default value: This will be determined by the following rules:- For x-axis with a continuous non-ordinal scale, the width will be the value of config.cell.widthconfig.htmlcell-config.- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if rangeStepscale.htmlordinal is a numeric value default, the width is determined by the value of rangeStep and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the rangeStep is fit, the width will be the value of config.cell.widthconfig.htmlcell-config.- If no field is mapped to x channel, the width will be the value of config.scale.textXRangeStepsize.htmldefault-width-and-height for text mark and the value of rangeStep for other marks.Note: For plot with row and column channels, this represents the width of a single cell.
width	Definition:  The width of a single visualization.Default value: This will be determined by the following rules:- For x-axis with a continuous non-ordinal scale, the width will be the value of config.cell.widthconfig.htmlcell-config.- For x-axis with an ordinal scale: if rangeStepscale.htmlordinal is a numeric value default, the width is determined by the value of rangeStep and the cardinality of the field mapped to x-channel.   Otherwise, if the rangeStep is fit, the width will be the value of config.cell.widthconfig.htmlcell-config.- If no field is mapped to x channel, the width will be the value of config.scale.textXRangeStepsize.htmldefault-width-and-height for text mark and the value of rangeStep for other marks.Note: For plot with row and column channels, this represents the width of a single cell.
